title: Afghanistan: What's life like since the Taliban took over?
description: People around the country tell the BBC they have lost basic freedoms and are struggling to survive.

title: Why does Alfred Wainwright still loom large over the Lake District?
description: Alfred Wainwright remains synonymous with the Lake District, but why is the connection so enduring?

title: Kenyan men join battle to end FGM
description: Campaigners say it is important that Kenyan men join the battle to end female genital mutilation.

title: Hamid Nouri: How Sweden arrested a suspected Iranian war criminal
description: Prosecutors have put Hamid Nouri on trial over a 1988 massacre in Iran. This is how they did it.

title: 'I studied law in jail - now I want to change the system'
description: LaTonya Myers spent nine months in jail because she couldn’t afford bail - now she's helping others facing the same challenge.

title: Why Scotland and Yorkshire are TV's top UK destinations
description: There's been a glut of shows featuring stunning scenery, simple lifestyles and down-to-earth people.

title: Jobs market set for bumpy ride, says Resolution Foundation
description: Those still on furlough face uncertain times when the scheme ends, the Resolution Foundation says.

title: Almost 50 shops a day disappear from High Streets
description: Britain's High Streets lost more than 8,700 stores in the first six months of 2021, research suggests.

title: NHS wait times: 'I’m not half the man I was'
description: Wayne Dennis, 50, has been waiting more than two years for treatment to his gallbladder.

title: Paralympics: ‘We the disabled community are here to stay’
description: Four champions share their glory and their pain from the 16th Paralympic Games in Tokyo.

title: 'I hid my litter picker in my suitcase'
description: Jenny I'Anson, 73, says she can spend up to five hours a day clearing rubbish.

title: New Zealand cinema worker left red-faced after voicemail blooper
description: A cinema employee in New Zealand went viral on TikTok with his attempt to leave a voicemail recording.

title: Ethiopia: Thousands of Tigray rebels killed, military claims
description: A leading general says 5,600 rebels have been killed in fierce fighting aided by airstrikes.

title: Bike crashes through driver's windscreen on M9 at West Lothian
description: The driver of a Ford Focus had a lucky escape after the bike broke free from another car as she drove through West Lothian.

title: Pride march returns to Glasgow after Covid pause
description: Participants, dressed in bright colours, were asked to take a lateral flow test before the event and wear masks.

title: British soldier describes caring for Kabul airport baby
description: Lt Col Ben Caesar helped look after the baby who was pulled over the airport wall in Afghanistan.

title: Tokyo Paralympics: Hannah Cockroft & Aled Sion Davies retain titles for GB
description: British athletes Hannah Cockroft and Aled Sion Davies retain their Paralympic titles, as canoeists Charlotte Henshaw and Laura Sugar also triumph on day 11 in Tokyo.

title: Covid: What do parents think about vaccinating children?
description: Parents share their thoughts on the prospect of offering Covid vaccines to all 12 to 15-year-olds.

title: Two missing divers presumed dead off Cornwall coast
description: The divers were exploring a former Royal Navy frigate which was sunk to create an offshore reef.

title: England v India: James Anderson dismisses KL Rahul for 46
description: James Anderson has KL Rahul caught behind for 46 as India lose the first wicket of their second innings, still 16 runs behind England's first innings total in the fourth Test at The Oval.

title: M62 crash: Police officer seriously injured in collision
description: West Yorkshire Police were trying to stop a car on the M62 when the crash happened.

title: Afghanistan: Former vice-president tells BBC he's in Panjshir Valley
description: Amrullah Saleh, in the Panjshir Valley, tells the BBC that fighters face a "difficult" situation.

title: Jadon Sancho: Man Utd winger out of England squad because of 'minor knock'
description: Manchester United winger Jadon Sancho has left the England squad after sustaining a "minor knock".

title: Afghanistan: Fresh fighting in final anti-Taliban stronghold
description: Conditions in the Afghan region are said to be difficult as the Taliban battle resistance fighters.

title: Can Cavendish beat Van Aert in Tour of Britain after Paris heartbreak?
description: Mark Cavendish is part of a group of top riders who will contest the Tour of Britain from Sunday - but there's one rider in particular he will be keen to beat.

title: Catwalk hail storm and cheeky capybaras - stories you may have missed
description: Some of the stories that you may have missed this week.

title: Covid-19: Decision on jabs for children due in days
description: There is a "strong case" for vaccinating healthy 12 to 15-year-olds, the government believes.

title: 'I've eaten the same breakfast for the last 22 years'
description: A veteran hotel inspector reveals the highs and lows of working undercover in Scotland.

title: Flu jab delay: Doctors call for MPs to take action
description: Flu jabs in England and Wales are delayed due to an HGV driver shortage, a supplier says.

title: BBC Radio 5 Live to broadcast Joshua's world heavyweight title defence against Usyk
description: Anthony Joshua's world heavyweight title defence against Oleksandr Usyk on 25 September is to be broadcast by BBC Radio 5 Live.

title: New Zealand supermarket stabbing: Government to toughen anti-terror laws
description: Seven people were injured, three critically, in Auckland by a known supporter of Islamic State.

title: Singing Leicestershire plumber lands record deal on job
description: Kev Crane's talents were spotted when he sang along to the radio as he fitted bathrooms.

title: Top street artists paint decks in aid of rural skatepark
description: More than 20 skateboards will be auctioned to raise money to build a rural skatepark.

title: US Open: Naomi Osaka to take break after title defence ended by teenager Leylah Fernandez
description: Naomi Osaka says she will take another break from tennis after her US Open title defence ends in the third round.

title: The Papers: Child jabs decision 'chaos', and royal funeral leak
description: Dominating Saturday's papers are reports that plans to vaccinate 12-15-year-olds are due to go ahead.

title: Then and now: Why deforestation is such a hot topic
description: Trees are part of the solution for climate change, but are we felling more than we are planting?

title: Afghanistan: Despair of Brits and UK allies stuck behind Taliban lines
description: An NHS worker, a teacher and families trapped in Afghanistan tell the BBC about their plans now.
